sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"宣布，公开"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: announce, declare, proclaim, pronounce, advertise, broadcast, publish
means: announce ：多指首次宣布大家感兴趣或可满足大家好奇心的事情。
declare ：侧重正式就某事清楚明白地宣布。
proclaim ：指官方宣布重大事件或施政方针，语体比announce正式。
pronounce ：词义与announce, declare接近，但较多用于指法律判决方面的宣布。
advertise ：指通过文字和图像资料等的反复宣传而引起公众的注意，有时隐含令人不快或言过其实的意味。
broadcast ：专指利用广播或电视传播消息或发表见解。
publish ：专指通过报刊或其它媒介向公众公布事情。

sentence.Network_en: Which do they want me to do? declare war or surrender?

sentence.Network_en: His lawyers are confident that the judges will declare Mr Stevens innocent.

sentence.Network_en: You may have to declare that you have had an HIV test.
sentence.Network_cn: 你可能需要声明自己已经做过艾滋病病毒检测。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Latin declarare, from de- 'thoroughly' + clarare 'make clear' (from clarus 'clear')

encyclopedia.content: declare，英文单词，意为：宣布，宣告；声明。在计算机语言中有vb中Declare语句、vf中的定义数组、Linux的命令、SQL中declare等含义。

entry.tran: 宣称，声称（…为事实）；表明(态度、意图等)
entry.def: If you declare that something is true, you say that it is true in a firm, deliberate way. You can also declare an attitude or intention.

example.ex: Speaking outside Ten Downing Street, she declared that she would fight on...
example.tran: 她在英国首相官邸外发表讲话时宣称她将继续斗争下去。

example.ex: 'I'm absolutely thrilled to have done what I've done,' he declared...
example.tran: 他宣称道：“我为自己的所作所为感到兴奋不已。”

entry.def: If you declare something, you state officially and formally that it exists or is the case.

example.ex: The government is ready to declare a permanent ceasefire...
example.tran: 政府准备宣布永久性停火。

example.ex: His lawyers are confident that the judges will declare Mr Stevens innocent...
example.tran: 史蒂文斯先生的律师们确信法官将宣告他无罪。

entry.def: If you declare goods that you have bought in another country or money that you have earned, you say how much you have bought or earned so that you can pay tax on it.

example.ex: Your income must be declared on this form...
example.tran: 必须在这张表格上申报你的收入。

example.ex: She had nothing to declare, and was starting to go through the 'Green' channel when she was stopped.
example.tran: 她没有什么要申报的，便开始进入绿色通道，结果就在这时被拦住了。

sentences.sentence: "He declared that he needed more money to carry out the task he was charged with"
"judge held that the defendant was innocent"

8. proclaim one's support, sympathy, or opinion for or against;

stems_affixes.word_buile: declare[v.宣称;断言]+ation表名词→n.定言;陈述
de加强+clare清楚,明白→强调清楚

Sentence.sentence: It is tempting to declare the Swedish policies regressive(退步的)and hail the American system as superior.
In 1961, when President Kennedy declared that America would send a man to the moon by the decade's end, those words, too, had a dreamlike quality.
Declaring that one country is better than another in the way that it treats more than half its citizens means relying on broad strokes and generalities.

means.word_mean: 宣布, 宣告; 声明

sentences.en: He declared that the meeting has been postponed.

means.word_mean: 断言, 宣称, 表明

jushi.english: He should declare at the Customs.
Ministers of the two countries declared their support for the Vienna talks.
jushi.chinese: 两国总理宣布他们支持维也纳会谈。
